content.description: Start in the big, lowest crack/pocket to the right of the face next to "Folded Ducks." Feet are awkward and deceptively hard to figure out. Pull off the ground to two more spaced vertical pockets, hit the pinch then the horn.  Top out on the big, bad holds.  Don't grab the sapling like I did and missed the (possible)FA.
content.location: Walk 100-150 yards straight past the bridge from the parking lot on the way to the Fundy or Fisherman's boulder. Walk off the trail to the right into the woods about 150 yards to a dirty boulder. Not sure if it's been climbed before but me and my friend Jared are calling it the Sapling boulder, for the tree growing out of the top. Let me know!  The other climb on it is Folded Ducks. Photo to come

content.description: Start on the back arete (away from the trail) on two sidepulls in some folded, orange rock with big feet.  Pull hard and throw left to the small crimp on the face.  The feet are surprisingly awkward but huge. Work on sidepulls and crimps on the face and arete to the top slopers.  Watch out for the branches!
content.location: Walk 100-150 yards straight past the bridge from the parking lot on the way to the Fundy or Fisherman's boulder.  Walk off the trail to the right into the woods about 150 yards to a dirty boulder.  Not sure if it's been climbed before but me and my friend Jared are calling it the Sapling boulder, for the tree growing out of the top. Let me know! The other climb on it is Horn Over My Pockets. Photo to come

content.description: A dirty boulder out past the Welcome Boulders near the fire road.  A sapling grows from its top, hence the name.
